sub_title: Leading the Sustainable Procurement Program at ING Nederlands
summary:
Passionate about sustainability and social impact, I thrive in dynamic and international environments, where my day to day activities have a meaningful impact on the development of the company and the societies where it operates. I am impact driven, resourceful with a hands-on, entrepreneurial mindset. Through my 11+ years’ of work experience I learned to be analytical, resourceful and interact with different stakeholders. 

Entrepreneurship is an adventure I would like to embark in the future - in the meantime I am looking for opportunities to grow professionally. I am very interested in International Project Management, Corporate Responsibility and Strategy.

projects.title: Global Enterprise Project (GEP)
projects.description:
The project started from the collaboration between the European Round Table of Industrialists (ERT) and JA Europe in order to promote greater understanding and awareness among young people about globalisation, entrepreneurship and the skills they need to succeed in the global economy.
A unique campaign under the JA Company Programme umbrella that involves hundreds of business people since 2011 from diverse global companies to raise young people's awareness on globalisation, foster entrepreneurship and reinforce the skills they need for the modern workforce.

The aim of the project is to:
- Close the skills gap between business and education.​
- Equip young people with skills they need to succeed in a global economy. ​
- Inspire young people to be more entrepreneurial and enterprising to:​ start companies,​ bring entrepreneurial skills and thinking into large companies and public institutions, and manage their career choices and their lives.

contributors.headline: Leading the Sustainable Procurement Program at ING Nederlands

projects.title: The European Entrepreneurship Education Network
projects.description: The European Entrepreneurship Education NETwork (EE-HUB) is a focal point for entrepreneurship education in Europe bringing together organizations and individuals from both the public and private sectors with strong records of accomplishment in entrepreneurship education at regional, national and European level. The EE-HUB is designed as the space where these stakeholders can work collectively to increase levels of entrepreneurial activities in schools across Europe.

contributors.headline: Leading the Sustainable Procurement Program at ING Nederlands

projects.title: Social Innovation Relay
projects.description:
Working with global partner HP, JA-YE Europe has developed the Social Innovation Relay to encourage students aged 15-18 to develop business concepts that are socially innovative and could have a significant positive social impact.

My role in the project was related to:
- country coordination (constant communication with the 19 countries around the world participating in the project) in order to achieve the objectives set by each country
- platform management (managed the e-platform, where the students worked on their ideas and where they connected with their e-mentors)
- social media management for the project

projects.title: IAMCP Annual Summit
projects.description:
IAMCP Annual Summit is the yearly event that brings together members of the International Association of Microsoft Channel Partners from across Europe. It is the perfect opportunity to network, build business connections, discuss about key policy issues that are influencing the European business environment.
This year, over 150 European CEOs from IAMCP and BizSpark have gathered in Brussels for the 4th edition of the Annual Summit, that also hosted the first European APPCUP competition (a Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8 app competition)

Public Policy & Government Relations Manager, TikTok Spain & Portugal
Government Affairs and Public Policy Professional

projects.title: NorthStar - Challenging the Nordic and Baltic ICT Powerhouse
projects.description: The event brought together Nordic Government elites, businesses and key European policy makers and engaged them in a dialogue around the main success factors and challenges of the Nordic ICT powerhouse. Keynote speakers, Toomas Hendrik Ilves (President of Estonia), Rigmor Aasrud (Minister of Government Administration, Norway) and Brad Smith (General Counsel and Executive Vice President, Legal and Corporate Affairs, Microsoft) discussed about what could be the main improvement points that the Nordic and Baltic region should make in order to help develop the ICT sector and presented good case practices from the Nordic region that can be taken forward by other European clusters.

contributors.headline: Leading the Sustainable Procurement Program at ING Nederlands

projects.title: IAMCP Presidents' Summit 2012
projects.description:
The International Association of Microsoft Channel Partners (IAMCP) is a large business network, with more than 5000 companies world-wide and over 1600 in Europe. 

Every year, the Presidents of the IAMCP European chapters get together in Brussels to reinforce their network, create new business opportunities and meet with key EU policy makers to discuss and influence key policy issues that can affect their business, like data protection or cloud computing.

projects.title: Policy and Reality for SMEs in the Digital Single Market
projects.description: Roundtable event to mark the celebration of the SME week and 20 years of Single Market in Europe. Entrepreneurs and policy makers sat together and discussed about the challenges and benefits of the Single Market for the businesses in Europe.

projects.title: Romania Youth Leadership Forum 2010
projects.description: Romania Youth Leadership Forum was the biggest youth conference in Romania in 2010. Its aim was to prepare over 500 member of the AIESEC network in management and leadership through qualitative trainings, delivered by over 40 companies and trainers, and sharing of valuable life experiences, by 7 of our remarkable people from different environments in Romania.

profile_positions.title: Sustainable Procurement Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
1. Community investment program manager 
- co-design and leadership of global community investment programs: tech social innovation challenges and digital skills/social entrepreneurship programs for young people;
- product manager of bespoke CMS platform used for global flagship community investment program. 

2. Sustainability reporting
- ESG data collecting and reporting for: LBG (community investment data for), DJSI, CDP.
- support the preparation of annual sustainability report (non-financial data)

3. Communication - managed the communication (internal and external stakeholders) for the community investment programs, coordinated the company’s participation in EU wide initiatives like Code Week, Safer Internet Day, Digital Skills & Jobs Coalition, Alliance to Better Protect Minors Online.

4. Sustainable Procurement - supported the implementation of the company-wide sustainable procurement strategy, using EcoVadis.

5. Financial management of the CR department
profile_positions.title: Corporate Social Responsibility Specialist
Project Manager (Entrepreneurship Education pan-European projects)

profile_positions.description:
1. Leading and managing network engagement initiatives:
- Manage relationship and engagement with the International Association of Microsoft Channel Partners;
- Project management for 4 high-profile events: coordinated and managed major conferences for the International Association of Microsoft Chanel Partners (180+ participants) and several roundtables.

2. Engagement with start-ups:
- Engage and showcase the startup community working with Microsoft (monthly blogs, policy related events, networking events);
- Promote the role of Cloud Computing as a critical component of the Microsoft SME ecosystem

3. Policy support:
- Support the management of policy campaigns (drafted responses to EC questionnaires, monitored the relevant policy discussions and prepared briefing documents)
- Support Senior managers in external meetings (taking minutes, writing reports, preparing briefing documents, etc)
profile_positions.title: Legal and Corporate Affairs Coordinator - SMEs Ecosystem

profile_positions.description:
1. Organisation Development (for the organisations' subsidiaries)
-  strategic planning process and the implementation of the HR processes for 5 subsidiaries (profile setting, tailored promotion, selection process, running interviews and managing onboarding);
- consulted local management teams to meet their objectives and develop effective leadership practices, achieving 48% growth from previous year.

2. Project & Event Management - opened a new subsidiary, managed 2 national conferences (80+ participants) and coordinated the recruitment projects in 4 subsidiaries.

3. Account Management - managed a national learning partner (CTI Norway), facilitating a coaching program for my colleagues for 1 year.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Head of Finance & Legal Department

•Applied for and received grants for 4,200€
•Implemented the accounting system
•Ensured financial sustainability by managing the local budget (20,000€)
•Recruited 10 members for the department and implemented a financial education program for them. 

Recruitment Project Manager

•Planned and implemented the communication and promotion activities around the project
